verbs.description: connubiate (third-person singular simple present connubiates, present participle connubiating, simple past and past participle connubiated)

entries.meaning: (rare, slang) To live together as man and wife; to marry; (loosely), to have relations.
examples: Let it be Rome, Milan, Naples, Florence, Turin, Venice, or Switzerland, and ‘egad!’ (as Bayes saith,) I will connubiate and join you; and we will write a new ‘Inferno’ in our Paradise.
